availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William "Harrison" Humphries (Fleming County, KY, farmer & corporal 4oth KY Mtd Inf USA, X mark, he or guardian has flag signature (ask DJT))

body.p: Fleming County, Kentucky, soldier. Kentucky native. Son of William M. Humphries and Mariah L. Humphries. Student in Fleming County in 1850. Student in Fleming County in 1860. Farmer in Fleming County in 1863. Served in the 40th Kentucky Volunteer Mounted Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a corporal from September 29, 1863, to December 30, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, Division 2, p. 388B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, District 2, p. 671.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 438.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0432.
